question.title: What is the main indication for implantable venous ports?
question.description: Types of venous access (central - including implantable chambers, tunnelled or peripheral - and peripheral), insertion sites, main indications for the different devices.

option_a.title: Chronic pain management
option_a.description: A common indication for implantable venous ports, particularly for patients with refractory pain.

option_b.title: Cancer treatment
option_b.description: Implantable venous ports are often used for chemotherapy administration in cancer patients.

option_c.title: Infectious disease treatment
option_c.description: Peripheral venous ports are commonly used for administering antibiotics to patients with infectious diseases.

option_d.title: Long-term hemodialysis
option_d.description: Central venous ports are often used for patients requiring long-term hemodialysis.

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
